name: Custom Stores
summary: Standard for global state containers, aligning with the Storage API.
description:
Design Philosophy

A CustomStore is a specialized Storage interface that adds observability. By extending the familiar getItem/setItem pattern with event-based subscriptions, we allow any data source (Redux, Zustand, IndexedDB) to be consumed via a standard API.

Interface Protocol

interface CustomStore extends EventTarget, Storage {
    // Standard Storage API
    readonly length: number;
    key(index: number): string | null;
    getItem(key: string): string | null;
    setItem(key: string, value: string): void;
    removeItem(key: string): void;
    clear(): void;

    // Meta-data
    readonly name: string; // e.g. 'session', 'local'

    // Subscription (via EventTarget)
    // Dispatches 'change' StorageEvent
}

Usage

const auth = customStores.get('auth');

auth.addEventListener('change', (e) => {
    console.log(`Key ${e.key} changed to ${e.newValue}`);
});

auth.setItem('token', '123');

name: Custom Signals
summary: Standard for reactive primitives, aligning with the TC39 Signals Proposal.
description:
Design Philosophy

Signals are the atomic units of reactivity. The CustomSignal protocol ensures that signals from different libraries (Preact, Solid, Angular) can interoperate within the same dependency graph.

Interface Protocol

interface CustomSignal<T> {
    // Core Value Access
    readonly value: T;
    peek(): T;

    // TC39 Alignment (Draft)
    // Represents a node in the reactive graph
    get(): T;
}

name: Custom Schemas
summary: Standard for structural validation (Zod, Supstruct, Yup integration).
description:
Design Philosophy

Validation logic is often tightly coupled to specific libraries. The CustomSchema protocol defines a universal contract for validating unknown data structures.

Interface Protocol

interface CustomSchema<T = unknown> {
    // Synchronous Validation
    validate(data: unknown): T; // throws ValidationError
    safeParse(data: unknown): {
        success: boolean;
        data?: T;
        error?: Error;
    };

    // Async Validation
    validateAsync?(data: unknown): Promise<T>;
}
